history.content: Others are more qualified to respond to this specific question than I am but I will remind you that it's obviously much more intense given that an entire semester's work is compressed into 8 weeks and there's no/little academic support beyond office hours. That's one reason why we do not allow time conflicts for CompSci classes over summer session.

I took 61c last summer, can confirm the 61c in summer is much more intensive than Dan Garcia in terms of curve, workload, and a compressed timeline. Our CPU project is due in 1 week, individually, compared to Dan Garcia's several week, and students can work in groups. Curve is low as you can infer from Berkeley time. much less percent of A+ and less than half of percentage of As.

Also add to instructors answer on 189, homework for last summer 189 is significantly reduced from previous semester[almost half of the hw] so don't worry too much about it. This is what I heard from my roommate who took 189 in summer. However, given the intensive nature of the course, it's still a lot of work especially in summer.

What are workloads like compared normal offerings - specifically for: 

1. 189 in the summer vs. Schewchuck's 189

2. 61C in the summer vs. 61C with Dan Garcia

Any other recommended math or CS classes for the summer?

Thanks!
history.subject: Summer CS class workloads
